name: Saltmarsh Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt & reagent supplier; seasonal provisioning outpost
economy_niches: Large-scale salt pans and refined salt export
Brine-derived ritual reagent collection and drying
Dried seafood processing (salted fish, kelp cakes)
Ship provisioning: rope, pitch, and foodstuffs
Seasonal reed/cordage harvest for maritime gear
culture_adjustments: Stronger labor-clan control over tidal work rhythms and quotas
Navigation rites emphasize tide-reading and salt-omens over star augury
Local Coastal Tongues dialect salted with maritime jargon and tally-marks
Merchant contracts adapted for seasonal access windows and spoilage risk
constraints: Limited fresh water and arable land
Seasonal accessibility tied to tides and weather
notes: Critical to state ritual-magic supply chain due to brine reagents
Managed commons and quotas enforced by harbor-clans
High demand for preservative expertise; attracts itinerant specialists
